In Ayurveda, P. longum is used in hepatosplenomegaly, respiratory disorders including asthma, chronic cough, tuberculosis, skin disorders, piles, diabetes, and anemia. It is also beneficial in fever and infection including typhoid and has analgesic effects in dyspepsia, worm infestation, and abdominal pain. It is also reported to have aphrodisiac properties. P. longum, P. nigrum, and Zingiber officinalis are combined in the Ayurvedic formulation Trikatu, which is effective in several ailments. It increases the action of other drugs by increasing the bioavailability, as piperine is the main biomarker compound.
